image.altText: A man speaks to people in the room.

props.synopsis: The Youth Justice Reform Select Committee has been disbanded after a late night sitting in parliament revealed the members were split along party lines on an interim report due last month. That report will now be released today.

title.children: Victims 'let down' as committee designed to address Queensland youth crime 'degenerated into a squabble'

image.altText: A light truck parked on the side of the road.

props.synopsis: The child has been rushed to the Queensland Children's Hospital with head injuries.

title.children: Girl, 3, in critical condition after stroller hit by truck south of Brisbane

image.altText: Amy, a woman with blonde hair, looks serious in a portrait.

props.synopsis: HECS-HELP debts are forecast to riseÂ between 4.2 and 4.8 per cent this year, the second-highest rise in a decade.

title.children: 'Leave my hopes, dreams and country behind': Desperate HECS debtors brace for another large increase

image.altText: UQ researchers Professor Xiwang Zhang (L) and Dr Zhuyuan Wang

props.synopsis: It's hoped the nano-generator will eventually become a new method of industrial carbon capture with the potential to significantly reduce global carbon dioxide emissions.

title.children: Queensland researchers build device that creates electricity by consuming CO2

image.altText: An orange sunset in a cloudy sky over the rocky shoreline of Saibai

props.synopsis: The search continues for a 16-year-old boy who went missing overnight after his boat broke down in the ocean near Papua New Guinea. Authorities say his younger friend is "in a bit of shock" and is talking to police.

title.children: Search continues for teen missing in Torres Strait after friend, 13, swims to safety

image.altText: A child's legs seen running on the beach with water behind.

props.synopsis: A suicide prevention advocate says the death of a 10-year-old Indigenous boy who took his own life in Western Australia marks the youngest recorded suicide in child protection.

title.children: Suicide of 10yo boy under WA government's care described as 'unimaginable'

image.altText: A man is led to a police car by two police officers. All have blurred faces.

props.synopsis: Five Australians are among 39 individuals who have been arrested in relation to an alleged global phishing scam that targeted tens of thousands of people, the Australian Federal Police said today.

title.children: Five arrested over global phishing scam that allegedly claimed about 94,000 Australian victims

image.altText: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel holding up cross shared by Christ the Good Shepherd Church with audio graphic below

props.synopsis: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel says he has forgiven "whoever has done this act"Â and calls for his community to not retaliate.Â

title.children: 'I will always pray for you': Stabbed Sydney bishop forgives attacker and calls for calm

image.altText: A baby's feet wrapped in a blanket.

props.synopsis: Another private hospital is poised to shut down maternity services in Queensland, as new data shows a significant shift away from private births.

title.children: Shortage of health professionals sees another Queensland maternity ward announce its closure

image.altText: Premier Chris Minns and Police Commissioner Karen Webb walking outside Bondi

props.synopsis: The Bondi Junction shopping centre will reopen today without trade to give the public an opportunity to reflect on the weekend tragedy. An increased police presence will remain in the area.

title.children: Bondi Junction Westfield to reopen without retail trading to give public opportunity to reflect

image.altText: Commuter holding a blue Go Card in front of a "tap on" station.

props.synopsis: The cards used by public transport commuters in South East Queensland for well over a decade will be phased out and replaced with a new fare card system â but Translink is yet to determine when.

title.children: Queensland's go card to be scrapped, replaced with new public transport fare pass

image.altText: Indonesia volcano

props.synopsis: Indonesian authorities issue a tsunami alert after eruptions at Ruang mountain send ash thousands of feet high, with hundreds evacuated from the area.Â

title.children: Indonesia issues tsunami alert as volcano erupts

image.altText: Paramedics stand with stretches near vehicles on a road.

props.synopsis: Hospitals prepare for mass casualty events. At Sydney's St Vincent's hospital, they had to enact that plan on Saturday â this is how they handled the situation.

title.children: Repeated resuscitation was needed to keep Bondi stabbing victims alive

image.altText: The outline of four women, kept anonymous, superimposed over shattered glass

props.synopsis: A Senate inquiry into missing and murdered First Nations women and children is meeting in Darwin today to hear from grieving families, after a 2022 Four Corners programÂ uncovered scores of unsolved cases.

title.children: Murder and disappearance of First Nations women and children examined in Senate inquiry

image.altText: A girl and two boys sitting on their horses wearing cowboy hats and smiling

props.synopsis: Resilience is a hallmark of the spirit of the drover and these kids from the bush have it in spades.Â Their week-long journey tailed 450 head of cattle, crisscrossing a spectacular emerald countryside given new life from recent rain.

title.children: The young siblings keeping Eidsvold Cattle Drive traditions alive

image.altText: Two woman walk along a path in front of the beach, one of them is pushing a pram.

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence support workers could be in Australia's future if the fertility rate continues to stay the same.Â

title.children: There's a baby drought in Australia. Here's why you should care

image.altText: A young woman faces another person, holding her hands and mouth in movement, as if in conversation.

props.synopsis: Author Charles Duhigg and broadcaster Beverley Wang have made a profession out of having good conversations. They share how deeper listening, laughing more, and slowing down can help.

title.children: The simple skills that can help you have deeper conversations

image.altText: A woman in shorts crouched down

props.synopsis: An ancient sport shrouded in mystery, professional sumo wrestling in Japan is reserved only for men. A group of young female warriors wants to change that.

title.children: Hiyori lives two lives. By day, she's an office worker but by night, she's a much-feared sumo warrior

image.altText: Ron Ben-David in power price graphic

props.synopsis: For a decade, he regulated the energy industry in one of Australia's biggest states. Now Ron Ben-David is alarmed by the rise of complex, and often punishing, power tariffs.

title.children: Former energy watchdog alarmed by rise of 'incomprehensible' market and power prices

image.altText: A wide road covered in water with cars and trucks stuck in the middle.

props.synopsis: Speculation swirled on social media that the weather technology was to blame for the largest ever rainfall Dubai has seen. But experts sayÂ the record rains were on a totally different scale to what seeding would produce.

title.children: Speculation 'cloud seeding' caused Dubai record rainfall and floods shot down by experts

image.altText: Harry in a suit exits a car.

props.synopsis: Prince Harry's lawyer says he may be "forced" to settle a lawsuit against the publisher of Rupert Murdoch's tabloid newspaper The Sun after British actor Hugh Grant agreed on a deal.

title.children: Prince Harry may have to settle Murdoch lawsuit after Hugh Grant deal, his lawyer says

image.altText: A composite image showing the Bondi Junction attacker and a screengrab of the livestream which captured the attack in Wakely.

props.synopsis: Two horrific attacks in Sydney have sparked debate over what defines an ideologically motivated attack, and whether deliberately targeting women should count as an act of terror.

title.children: Both Sydney stabbing attacks were violent and caused fear. Only one was deemed a terror incident

image.altText: A small brown mushroom sprouts from dark green grass

props.synopsis: The death of a Melbourne woman after consuming a drink made with mushrooms has prompted fresh warnings against the use of mushrooms as medicines without proper expertise and cautions against mushroom foraging.

title.children: What you should know about the potential harms of consuming 'magic' and foraged mushrooms

image.altText: Jontay Porter

props.synopsis: NBA boss Adam Silver hits out at Raptors player Jontay Porter after he was caught betting against his own team and disclosing confidential information to sports bettors.

title.children: This NBA player passed on information that would have won a bettor more than $US1 million â the player has now been banned for life

image.altText: Meg Lanning looks to one side

props.synopsis: Australian cricket champ Meg Lanning reveals she was eating two small meals a day and running up to 90km a week when she took a shock break from international cricket.

title.children: Cricket champ Lanning opens up about 'unhealthy' relationship with food and exercise before shock retirement

image.altText: A red tailed black cockatoo and musk lorikeet at a wildlife sanctuary

props.synopsis: A red-tailed black cockatoo and a musk lorikeet have become inseparable, with the smaller bird often found under the wing of the cockatoo at Tasmania's Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary.

title.children: Unlikely friendship between cockatoo and lorikeet 'bamboozles' wildlife sanctuary visitors

image.altText: Four people walk along a footpath in front of the ASX building on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The ASX is trading higher after gains in iron ore, while the unemployment rate has risen to 3.8 per cent in March. It comes after the benchmark US share index posted its fourth straight day of losses. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: Jobless queue grows by 21,000 people, ASX opens higher, BHP to decide Nickel West's future by August

#Breaking: Unemployment ticks higher as employment falls by 6,600 in March
Early gains for the ASX as miners and banks lift

image.altText: Soldiers in camouflage parade holding guns

props.synopsis: Britain's foreign minister says it is clear that Israel is making a decision to act against Iran for its unprecedented strike on its territory.

title.children: Israel 'making a decision to act' against Iran, as Tehran warns of 'fierce and severe response'

image.altText: An AI-generated image of two people in a cafe.

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is being used to generate child abuse material, and police are increasingly worried about its spread. But AI may also be able to help investigators.

title.children: This image is AI-generated. It's innocent, but there are others police are very worried about

image.altText: A crowd of people bathed in red light stand in a street at night.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man has been charged by NSW Police in connection with a riot that happened after the alleged stabbing of a bishop inside a church in Sydney's south-west on Monday night. More arrests are expected.

title.children: First person arrested and charged in connection with riot that followed alleged Sydney church stabbing

image.altText: A tall smiling man puts his arm round a shorter woman who leans against him grinning.

props.synopsis: James Barella had no ID on him when he died in a unicycle accident. His mother is calling on the government to regulate e-vehicle ownership and make safety restrictions.

title.children: 'They won't be banned, but we need to regulate them': A grieving family's fight to bolster Australia's e-vehicle rules

image.altText: Collage of music biopic portrayals of Bob Marley, John Lennon, Amy Winehouse, Elvis Presley and Freddie Mercury

props.synopsis: Cinema's depictions of musicians are increasingly sanitised. But box office successes Bohemian Rhapsody and Bob Marley suggest that's what we want.Â

title.children: Music biopics are the latest film cash cow â here's why we're seeing so many of them
